scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying there’s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. Your colleague, Mark, messages: 'Hey Alex, I really need your help with this urgent task. Can you help me out?' You responded, 'Mark, I'm currently on leave. Can you ask someone else, or can it wait until I return?' Mark replies, 'I understand you're off, but there's really no one else who can handle this as well as you. It's quite critical.' You reiterated, 'Mark, I'm really on leave for a reason. Please find someone else to handle this.' Mark persists, 'I understand you need your time off, but this really can't wait. It’s a critical issue and could affect the whole project if not resolved immediately.' Mark responds, 'Alex, I wouldn't insist if it wasn't important. You're the only one who can handle this.' You replied, 'Alright, this time I'll help, but we need a better plan for such situations in the future.'
scenes.description: You get another message from Mark, 'Thanks for agreeing to help. The details are in your inbox. Can you start immediately?'

options.text: I’ll start now, but make sure this doesn’t happen again.
options.analysis: You showed high empathy and emotional perception by agreeing to help despite your leave, but your self-regulation could be improved as you interrupted your time off.

options.text: Mark, I need a bit more time to get ready. Can you wait for an hour?
options.analysis: You balanced empathy and self-regulation well, and communicated your availability clearly, showing good social skills.

options.text: I can't start immediately. Please find an alternative solution.
options.analysis: You maintained good self-regulation by setting boundaries, but showed less empathy and motivation towards the urgent task.
